```{r}
# Install and load the required package
if (!requireNamespace("quantmod", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("quantmod")
}
library(quantmod)

# Define the stock ticker symbol and date range
ticker <- "NVDA"
start_date <- "2020-01-01"
end_date <- "2024-12-31"

# Fetch the stock data from Yahoo Finance
nvidia_data <- getSymbols(ticker, src = "yahoo", from = start_date, to = end_date, auto.assign = FALSE)

# Display the first few rows of the data
head(nvidia_data)

```



```{r}
# 1 - Data Preprocessing
# Handle missing values by removing rows with NA values
nvidia_data <- na.omit(nvidia_data)

# Convert date strings to datetime objects (already done by getSymbols)

# Normalize the data (optional)
# Here we normalize the adjusted closing prices
nvidia_data$NVDA.Adjusted <- scale(nvidia_data$NVDA.Adjusted)

# Display the first few rows of the cleaned and normalized data
head(nvidia_data)
```


```{r}
# 2 - Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
# Plot the opening prices
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
plot(nvidia_data$NVDA.Open, main = "Opening Prices of NVDA", ylab = "Price", xlab = "Date")

```


```{r}
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
# Plot the closing prices
plot(nvidia_data$NVDA.Close, main = "Closing Prices of NVDA", ylab = "Price", xlab = "Date")


```


```{r}
# Plot the high prices
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
plot(nvidia_data$NVDA.High, main = "High Prices of NVDA", ylab = "Price", xlab = "Date")

```



```{r}

# Plot the low prices
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
plot(nvidia_data$NVDA.Low, main = "Low Prices of NVDA", ylab = "Price", xlab = "Date")
```



```{r}
# Plot the volume
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
plot(nvidia_data$NVDA.Volume, main = "Volume of NVDA", ylab = "Volume", xlab = "Date")
```


```{r}
# Plot the normalized adjusted closing prices
plot(nvidia_data$NVDA.Adjusted, main = "Normalized Adjusted Closing Prices of NVDA", ylab = "Normalized Price", xlab = "Date")
```
